name: Avoid using setTimeout() (Javascript)
description: This rule will raise a violation when the first argument given to setTimeout() function is a string.
output:
Associated to each violation, the following information is provided:
- The number of violation occurrences
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in the source code
rationale:
When a string is passed as first argument of the setTimeout(), it is dynamically executed. 
If a part of that string comes from an input from an upstream component, it could allow arbitrary code to be run and represents a security issue. 
Furthermore dynamic evaluation of code can be slower.
remediation: Use a function as first argument of the setTimeout function.
total: Number of Javascript Functions using setTimeout
alternativeName: Avoid using setTimeout with a string as first argument
